io.confluent.ksql.query

Interface QueryRegistry

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    QueryRegistryImpl

    public interface QueryRegistry
    Interface for building and managing queries.

    Callers can build transient and persistent queries. Once built, the queries are owned by the implementation of this interface. The caller creating the query receives a handle to the created query. The handle is a child class of QueryMetadata.

    Callers can also get a handle to to a query via the query ID, and list all queries managed by a registry.

    QueryRegistry also supports tracking the sink data source for each query. In particular, callers can ask for the query that was started by the C(S|T)AS statement that created a source, and can get a list of all queries writing into a source.

    Finally, the implementation should support subscribing to events about queries by implementing the QueryEventListener interface.

      • createOrReplacePersistentQuery

        PersistentQueryMetadata createOrReplacePersistentQuery(SessionConfig config,
                                                       ServiceContext serviceContext,
                                                       ProcessingLogContext processingLogContext,
                                                       MetaStore metaStore,
                                                       java.lang.String statementText,
                                                       QueryId queryId,
                                                       DataSource sinkDataSource,
                                                       java.util.Set<SourceName> sources,
                                                       ExecutionStep<?> physicalPlan,
                                                       java.lang.String planSummary,
                                                       boolean createAsQuery)
        Create a persistent query, and possibly replace an existing query if one exists with the same ID. Replacement will fail if migration from the current to the new physical plan is not supported.

      • getPersistentQuery

        java.util.Optional<PersistentQueryMetadata> getPersistentQuery(QueryId queryId)
        Get a persistent query by ID
        Parameters:
        queryId - The ID of the persistent query to get
        Returns:
        The query with ID queryID, if such a query is registered.

      • getPersistentQueries

        java.util.Map<QueryId,PersistentQueryMetadata> getPersistentQueries()
        Get all persistent queries
        Returns:
        All persistent queries, keyed by ID

      • getQueriesWithSink

        java.util.Set<QueryId> getQueriesWithSink(SourceName sourceName)
        Get all queries with a given sink
        Parameters:
        sourceName - The name of the source to list queries for
        Returns:
        A set of query IDs that contains the IDs of queries writing into sourceName

      • getAllLiveQueries

        java.util.List<QueryMetadata> getAllLiveQueries()
        Get all queries registered with the registry
        Returns:
        List of all queries that are registered (both transient and persistent).

      • getCreateAsQuery

        java.util.Optional<QueryMetadata> getCreateAsQuery(SourceName sourceName)
        Get the query started by the C(S|T)AS statement that created a given source
        Parameters:
        sourceName - the name of the source to get the creating query for
        Returns:
        the query started by the C(S|T)AS that created sourceName

      • getInsertQueries

        java.util.Set<QueryId> getInsertQueries(SourceName sourceName,
                                        java.util.function.BiPredicate<SourceName,PersistentQueryMetadata> filterQueries)
        Get all insert queries that write into or read from a given source.
        Parameters:
        sourceName - The source name to fetch queries for.
        filterQueries - A predicate to apply to filter the returned list of queries
        Returns:
        All insert queries that match the predicate and write into the given source.

      • createSandbox

        QueryRegistry createSandbox()
        Create a sandbox copy of the query registry. The sandbox can be used for validation, but the contained queries cannot be started, stopped, or closed.
        Returns:
        A sandbox instance of the current registry.

      • close

        void close(boolean closePersistent)
        Close the query registry and free up its resources.
        Parameters:
        closePersistent - if true, the underlying queries will be closed, meaning all state will be destroyed. If false, the persistent queries owned by the registry will be stopped by calling stop(). Transient queries are always closed.
